column4: Will someone help me please? I'm getting the "Failed to start X server..." message after doing sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I changed the mount options on my 20GB portable media player and I put something wrong and it's not mounting now. How can I still access the drive so that I can fix the problem?
what do you mean, you put something wrong?  could you be more specific as to what you did when your player wouldn't mount any more?
It said I put a wrong character in the mount options and it's not mounting anymore. I need to get back to settings to change what I entered to the right info.
I'm sure you do.  so where did you change the mount option for your media player?

When mounted, an Icon was put on the desktop. I right clicked it and went to properties.I then when to one of the tabs and changed the mount options to have fmask=777, etc. so that it would allow me to create and remove files.
when you plug in the player, check dmesg to find its device name.  maybe we can mount it manually to fix it.
AV_LYRA is the volume name shown in error. dmesg doesn't show too much about device names.
pastebin the error / dmesg output for us.
you can find the "dmesg" output at the following link: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25526/
your player is this Thomson player?
Yes, it's a RCA LYRA RD2780. Thomson is the HDD brand name.
i'm not sure what's going on dude.  sorry.
I thought as much... It's hard. Thanks for trying!
there are some weird messages in your dmesg output though.
